description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (Section 73) to vary Condition 5 (Hours of Operation) of Planning Permission ref. P/2005/3196 dated 18.11.2005 for 'Change of use from A1 to A5 with extract duct at side of property'. Amendment seeks to extend the hours of operation for late-night services
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of Planning Permission ref. P/2005/3196 dated 18.11.2005.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The soundproofing between the subject unit and residential accommodation above shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details of soundproofing approved by the Local Planning Authority on application ref. P/2006/0130 dated 06.06.2006 and retained for the duration of the use.

REASON: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Extract ducting (including anti-vibration measures) and odour abatement measures shall be installed/implemented and maintained in strict accordance with the details approved by the Local Planning Authority on application ref. P/2006/0476 dated 06.06.2006 for the duration of the use.

REASON: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties and the character of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A waste management scheme, providing details of refuse storage and disposal facilities, for both customer and commercial waste, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the conversion of the premises. Refuse storage and disposal facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the commencement of the Class A5 use and shall be retained for the duration of the use.

REASON: To protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 7.3 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The hours of business for the hot food takeway use (Use Class A5) hereby approved shall not be outside the hours of 1100 - 0100hrs Monday to Sunday. All activities on-site shall cease within sixty minutes of the close of business.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and the prospective residential occupiers of the development in accordance with polices 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Deliveries to and collections from the site (excluding refuse collections) shall only take place between 8am and 6pm, Monday - Saturday, and at no time on Sundays or Bank/Public Holidays.

REASON: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
